intro: Hieracium blaui, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow to orange flowers that are surrounded by a ring of pale blue or white ray florets. Its leaves are typically basal, forming a rosette, and are covered in fine hairs. Hieracium blaui is often found in meadows and grassy areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
